alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 7:05AM CDT until October 26 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork Trinity River At Grand Prairie affecting Dallas and Tarrant Counties. Elm Fork Trinity River Near Carrollton affecting Dallas County. Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Rowlett Creek Near Sachse affecting Dallas County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut Creek near Mansfield. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek through Mansfield, downstream of Joe Pool Lake. At 22 feet, Retta Road, North Street, Walnut Creek Road, and Magnolia Road are all flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 19.7 feet this morning. It will then rise to 21.4 feet late this morning. It will fall below flood stage late this morning to 8.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 8.2 feet late tonight. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
